insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: What does Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule) Home Insurance (Coverall Policy) insurance exclude?
faqs.answer:
The following are NOT covered under Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)'s Home Insurance (Coverall Policy) policy:

• Wear and tear, corrosion, damp, mould, dry/wet rot, fungus, gradual deterioration
• Maintenance and normal upkeep costs
• Loss or damage while property is unoccupied (60+ days)
• Terrorism
• War, invasion, civil war, rebellion, revolution, insurrection
• Nuclear contamination and radioactive materials
• Pollution and contamination (except specific circumstances)
• Sonic bangs from aircraft
• Vermin, insects, pets or domesticated animals
• Mechanical or electrical breakdown/failure
• Faulty workmanship, materials or design (except property owner liability)
• Damage from contractors' activities
• Business use (except specified business equipment)
• Motorised vehicles or craft (with specific exceptions)
• Reduction in value after repair
• Confiscation or detention by authorities
• Riot or civil commotion outside United Kingdom
• Subsidence to drives, patios, terraces, walls, gates, fences (unless main building damaged)
• Coastal or riverbank erosion
• Settlement, shrinkage or expansion
• Storm damage to fences and gates
• Frost damage (to underground services and certain circumstances)
• Theft without evidence of forced entry when property is let/sublet
• Loss by deception (except deception solely to enter property)
• Theft from unoccupied property
• Damage from trees being cut down within the home grounds
• Cyber loss (for Section 8 - Claims Preparation Assistance)
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)

• Terrorism

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: What endorsements are available for Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule) Home Insurance (Coverall Policy) insurance?
faqs.answer:
The following endorsements can be added to Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)'s Home Insurance (Coverall Policy) policy:

**Security Requirements**
May specify required locks, alarms, or security devices
Cost impact: Affects premium; failure to comply may void cover
Coverage impact: Non-compliance may result in claim rejection or non-payment

**Unoccupied Property**
Additional requirements/restrictions when property unoccupied
Cost impact: May increase premium
Coverage impact: Significant restrictions on theft, water damage, malicious damage cover

**Subsidence Exclusion/Excess**
May exclude or increase excess for subsidence claims
Cost impact: May reduce premium if excluded
Coverage impact: Removes or limits subsidence cover

**Structural Works Exclusion**
Restrictions during building works, extensions, renovations
Cost impact: Variable
Coverage impact: Must notify before works commence; may exclude certain perils during works

**High Value Items**
Specified items listed individually with values
Cost impact: Increases premium based on declared value
Coverage impact: Increases limit for specified valuable items

**Let Property**
Additional terms for properties that are rented/let
Cost impact: Increases premium
Coverage impact: Modifies theft requirements (need forced entry evidence)

**Excess Variations**
Changes to standard excess amounts
Cost impact: Higher excess typically reduces premium
Coverage impact: Changes amount customer pays per claim
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: What documents are needed to file a claim with Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule) Home Insurance (Coverall Policy)?
faqs.answer:
To file a claim with Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)'s Home Insurance (Coverall Policy) policy, you need:

• Completed claim form
• Police crime reference number (for theft, riot, malicious damage, lost property away from home)
• Purchase receipts or proof of ownership
• Instruction manuals, guarantee cards
• Valuations (for items over £2,500)
• Photographs of items/damage
• Utility bills or local authority bills
• Pre-purchase surveys
• Property deeds or plans
• Bank/credit card statements
• Estimates for repair/replacement
• Proof of Sold Secure lock ownership (for cycle claims away from home)
• Evidence of alarm maintenance contract (if required by endorsement)
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: How quickly must I report a claim to Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule) Home Insurance (Coverall Policy)?
faqs.answer: As soon as possible after discovery; theft/riot/malicious damage within 24 hours (theft to police); riot within 7 days (to police)
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: What is the claims process for Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule) Home Insurance (Coverall Policy)?
faqs.answer:
Follow these steps to file a claim:

1. 1. Check if policy covers the loss/damage by reviewing Schedule
2. 2. Take immediate steps to prevent further damage
3. 3. For theft/criminal damage: Report to police within 24 hours and obtain crime reference
4. 4. For riot: Report to police within 7 days
5. 5. For credit card theft: Report to police and card company within 24 hours
6. 6. Contact claims department on 08000 327327 (24/7) or through broker/agent
7. 7. Do NOT dispose of damaged items before inspection
8. 8. Do NOT carry out permanent repairs before inspection
9. 9. Take reasonable steps to recover missing property
10. 10. Provide all requested documentation and cooperate with investigation
11. 11. Obtain repair estimates if requested
12. 12. For liability claims: Send all correspondence immediately without admitting liability
13. 13. Allow insurer access to damaged property
14. 14. Claims over £20,000: Claims Preparation Assistance may be offered
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: What evidence is needed for Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule) Home Insurance (Coverall Policy) claims?
faqs.answer: Police reports (crime reference number for theft/criminal damage), original receipts, valuations (for items over £2,500, must be within 3 years), photographs, proof of ownership, proof of security measures (locks/alarms), utility bills, repair estimates
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: What are the age requirements for Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule) Home Insurance (Coverall Policy)?
faqs.answer: No specific age restrictions for policyholder mentioned
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: What medical restrictions apply to Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule) Home Insurance (Coverall Policy)?
faqs.answer: Not applicable (property insurance)
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: Are there occupational restrictions for Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule) Home Insurance (Coverall Policy)?
faqs.answer: Business use restricted to clerical work only (Business Equipment up to £5,000)
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: What are the residency requirements for Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule) Home Insurance (Coverall Policy)?
faqs.answer: Must be private residential property in United Kingdom; persons normally living together qualify as 'You'
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: How does Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule) Home Insurance (Coverall Policy) define 'Accidental Damage'?
faqs.answer: Sudden, unexpected and unintentional physical damage
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: How does Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule) Home Insurance (Coverall Policy) define 'Bodily Injury'?
faqs.answer: Physical injury, death or disease caused by sudden, unexpected, external and visible event
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: How does Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule) Home Insurance (Coverall Policy) define 'Buildings'?
faqs.answer: The home, fixtures & fittings, permanent structures within boundary including tennis courts, patios, drives, walls, fences, gates, hedges, drains, pipes, cables, tanks, swimming pools, solar panels, wind turbines, ground source heating pumps
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: How does Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule) Home Insurance (Coverall Policy) define 'Contents'?
faqs.answer: Household goods, personal property and Business Equipment within the Home belonging to you or you're legally responsible for. Includes tenant's fixtures, aerials, hot tubs (not permanent), deeds/documents (£1,500 limit), stamps/coins collections (£2,500 limit), Valuables (33% Contents sum insured, 10% single item limit)
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: How does Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule) Home Insurance (Coverall Policy) define 'Excess'?
faqs.answer: The first part of any claim you have to pay as stated on Schedule or Endorsement
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: How does Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule) Home Insurance (Coverall Policy) define 'Home'?
faqs.answer: The private dwelling and domestic outbuildings and garages at the address on Schedule
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: How does Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule) Home Insurance (Coverall Policy) define 'Money'?
faqs.answer: Cash, cheques, postal orders, unused postage stamps (not collections), savings stamps/certificates, share certificates, premium bonds, luncheon vouchers, travellers cheques, travel tickets, season tickets, phone cards, gift tokens - NOT including event tickets or business items
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: How does Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule) Home Insurance (Coverall Policy) define 'Motorised Vehicle or Craft'?
faqs.answer: Mechanically propelled/assisted vehicles including motorcycles, quad bikes, trikes, go karts, trailers, caravans, aircraft, drones, hovercraft, boats, sailboards - EXCLUDING domestic gardening vehicles, mobility scooters/wheelchairs, golf carts, remote-controlled toys
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: How does Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule) Home Insurance (Coverall Policy) define 'Personal Possessions'?
faqs.answer: Items that you wear, use or carry about your person, belonging to you or you're legally responsible for. NOT including contact lenses, dentures, dental work
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: How does Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule) Home Insurance (Coverall Policy) define 'Period of Insurance'?
faqs.answer: Length of time insurance is in force as shown on Schedule, for which premium paid and accepted
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: How does Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule) Home Insurance (Coverall Policy) define 'Storm'?
faqs.answer: Violent weather with: wind 48+ knots (55mph) OR rain 25mm+ per hour OR snow 30cm+ in 24 hours OR hail breaking glass/damaging hard surfaces
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: How does Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule) Home Insurance (Coverall Policy) define 'Subsidence'?
faqs.answer: Downward movement of ground beneath Buildings (other than Settlement)
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: How does Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule) Home Insurance (Coverall Policy) define 'Heave'?
faqs.answer: Upward or sideways movement of ground beneath Buildings caused by soil expanding
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: How does Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule) Home Insurance (Coverall Policy) define 'Landslip'?
faqs.answer: Downward movement of sloping ground
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: How does Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule) Home Insurance (Coverall Policy) define 'Settlement'?
faqs.answer: Downward movement of properties after built, caused by compression of soil
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: How does Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule) Home Insurance (Coverall Policy) define 'Tenant'?
faqs.answer: Occupier of Home when let (including holiday lets) OR leaseholder
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: How does Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule) Home Insurance (Coverall Policy) define 'Unoccupied'?
faqs.answer: a) Furnished but not lived in for 60+ days in a row (must be occupied 5 nights/row each month OR 2 nights/row each week) OR b) Insufficiently furnished for normal habitation
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: How does Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule) Home Insurance (Coverall Policy) define 'Valuables'?
faqs.answer: Jewellery, furs, gold, silver, precious metals, gems, stones, pictures, paintings, works of art
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: How does Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule) Home Insurance (Coverall Policy) define 'You/Your'?
faqs.answer: Person named as policyholder on Schedule and: husband, wife, partner (living as married), civil partner, children, parents, relatives - who normally live with them
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: How does Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule) Home Insurance (Coverall Policy) define 'Domestic Staff'?
faqs.answer: Person employed for private domestic duties at Home, not employed in any trade/profession/employment capacity
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: How does Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule) Home Insurance (Coverall Policy) define 'Terrorism'?
faqs.answer: Use of biological, chemical, nuclear force or contamination by any person/group for political, religious, ideological purposes including influencing government or causing public fear
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: How does Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule) Home Insurance (Coverall Policy) define 'Business Equipment'?
faqs.answer: Computer equipment (including software but excluding data) and office equipment used for clerical purposes in connection with business run from Home
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: What happens if my home is unoccupied for more than 60 days?
faqs.answer: Many covers are suspended including theft, escape of water, malicious damage, oil escape. You must notify insurer immediately if property becomes unoccupied. Cover can be arranged but with restrictions. 'Lived in' means occupied at least 5 nights in a row each month OR 2 nights in a row each week.
faqs.section_reference: Definition of 'Unoccupied' page 6; Exclusions throughout Sections 1 and 2
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: Are my valuables covered away from home?
faqs.answer: Only if you have Section 3 - Personal Possessions and Valuables cover. This provides worldwide cover but with limits: £2,500 per unspecified item, £1,500 from unattended vehicle, £2,000 for jewellery theft from hotel rooms. Items over £2,500 must be specified on Schedule.
faqs.section_reference: Section 3 - Personal Possessions and Valuables, page 32-33
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: What security do I need for my pedal cycle when away from home?
faqs.answer: Cycles must be in a secured locked building OR secured through the frame by a locked security device to an immovable object. For cycles valued over £1,500, must use a 'Sold Secure Gold' standard lock, and you must provide proof of ownership of this lock (receipt, photo, bank statement, or retailer confirmation).
faqs.section_reference: Section 4 - Pedal Cycles page 34; Claim Conditions page 14-15
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: Does Buildings cover include my garden walls and fences?
faqs.answer: Walls and fences ARE included in the Buildings definition, but have limited cover. They are NOT covered for: storm damage, damage from falling trees, subsidence (unless main building damaged at same time). They ARE covered for: fire, flood, impact, theft, malicious damage (if property not unoccupied).
faqs.section_reference: Definition of Buildings page 4; Section 1 exclusions pages 17-18
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: What if I need to make a structural change to my property?
faqs.answer: You must notify insurer before starting any: extensions, work on load-bearing walls, roofing work over 20%, structural works including demolition, or any works costing 50%+ of Buildings sum insured. Failure to notify may result in no cover during works and subsidence claims being excluded.
faqs.section_reference: General Conditions - Changes you must tell us about, page 8; Section 1 exclusion 10(f), page 18
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: Am I covered if my tenant damages the property?
faqs.answer: No - damage by tenants or occupants is excluded. However, if you are a tenant yourself, you have Tenant's Liability cover (Section 2K) which covers your legal liability for damage to the landlord's building, up to 10% of Contents sum insured, excluding fire/lightning/explosion to building structure.
faqs.section_reference: General Exclusions 8, page 13; Section 2K - Tenant's Liability, page 28
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: How quickly must I report a theft to the police?
faqs.answer: Ideally within 24 hours of discovery. You must obtain a crime reference number. For riot, you must inform police within 7 days. Failure to report to police within reasonable time may affect your claim.
faqs.section_reference: Claim Conditions page 14; Section 1 exclusion 9, page 19; Section 2 exclusion 9, page 24
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: What is covered for alternative accommodation if I can't live in my home?
faqs.answer: Up to 20% of your Buildings or Contents sum insured for accommodation of same standard as your existing home, plus storage of contents, for you and domestic pets. Not covered: costs recoverable elsewhere, costs without insurer agreement, costs after property ready for habitation, if property not going to be reinstated.
faqs.section_reference: Section 1C - Loss of rent/alternative accommodation page 19; Section 2C - Alternative accommodation page 25
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: Are business items covered in my home?
faqs.answer: Very limited cover. Business Equipment (computers and office equipment for clerical purposes only) up to £5,000 is covered. No other business property is covered. Professional/trade use beyond clerical work is excluded.
faqs.section_reference: Definition of Contents page 4; Definition of Business Equipment page 4; General Exclusions 8, page 13
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: What should I do immediately after discovering damage?
faqs.answer: 1. Take steps to prevent further damage (e.g. turn off water/gas); 2. If theft/criminal damage, report to police within 24 hours for crime reference; 3. Do NOT dispose of damaged items; 4. Do NOT carry out permanent repairs; 5. Take photos if possible; 6. Contact claims line 08000 327327 (24/7) as soon as practical; 7. Keep all receipts for emergency measures.
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: Is subsidence covered?
faqs.answer: Yes, subsidence, heave and landslip are covered under Section 1 number 10 and Section 2 number 10. However, there are significant exclusions: damage to drives, patios, walls, fences, fuel tanks, pools (unless main building damaged); damage to solid floors (unless foundations beneath walls damaged); normal settlement; coastal erosion; damage during structural works; compensation available elsewhere. Check Schedule for any subsidence excess or exclusion endorsement.
faqs.section_reference: Section 1 number 10, page 18; Section 2 number 10, page 24
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: Can I cancel my policy and get a refund?
faqs.answer: Yes. Within 14 days (cooling off): full refund if not started, pro-rata if started. After 14 days: pro-rata refund for unused cover. However, NO refund if you have made a claim or are in the process of making a claim in the current period. If paying by instalments and claim is settled, you must continue payments to renewal or amount will be deducted from claim payment. Minimum refund is £10.
faqs.section_reference: General Conditions 4 - Cancellation, page 9; General Conditions 14 - Refunds, page 11
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: What are the index linking provisions?
faqs.answer: Buildings and Contents sums insured are adjusted monthly. Buildings linked to House Rebuilding Cost Index (RICS). Contents linked to Consumer Durable Section of Retail Price Index. Your renewal premium is calculated on the adjusted sum insured. Sums insured continue to increase during claims if you ensure repairs done without undue delay. Valuables and Personal Possessions are NOT index linked - you must ensure adequate cover.
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: What is covered for escape of water?
faqs.answer: Damage from water escaping from fixed water tanks, apparatus or pipes is covered. Also covers frost damage to these items. However, NOT covered: while unoccupied, taps left on causing overflow (unless you have accidental damage cover), damage to fuel tanks or swimming pools, subsidence (covered separately). Also covered: tracing the leak (up to £5,000) and increased water charges (up to £1,000).
faqs.section_reference: Section 1 number 4, page 17; Section 1G Trace & access, page 20; Section 1E Loss of water, page 20
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)

faqs.insurer: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
faqs.question: Do I need to have valuations for my valuable items?
faqs.answer: Yes, for all Valuables valued in excess of £2,500 you must hold an appropriate valuation no more than 3 years old, which must be made available if you claim. For jewellery over £7,500, must be inspected by professional jeweller (NAJ member) at least every 3 years with defects remedied. Failure to provide valuation may affect claim payment.
faqs.section_reference: General Conditions 7 - Proof of value, page 10; Section 3 exclusion (e), page 32
tags: prestige underwriting services ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on schedule)
